summary: Flanders is the Dutch-speaking northern part of Belgium. It's one of Belgium's official communities and regions. With a population of over 6.8 million, it's more than half of Belgium's total population. Flanders is mostly flat and includes Belgium's North Sea coast. Its official language is Dutch. Historically, Flanders was very important in Europe, especially for its cloth trade and wealth. Today, Flanders and Brussels are much richer than Wallonia, another region in Belgium. Flanders is divided into five provinces and includes cities like Antwerp, Ghent, and Bruges.
title: Flanders
